I don't think exceptionally and gracefully are accurate descriptions. In one case an exception was provided, and in another it wasn't but it doesn't follow that one is graceful and the other isn't.

One code path amounts to calling request.exceptionProcessingRequest while the other calls request.authenticationFailed, albeit not in the same place where the gracefully/exceptionally terminology is being used.
One is more abrupt than the other.
I'm open to any suggestion wrt to terminology. For now I've removed both these keywords from the log lines.
It seems weird to have an onFailure with a possibly null exception. I get that it's handled correctly below, but can't it be handled here and be more idiomatic?
